comment.author: 42264328@N00
comment._content: A "Bull Mooser" was a supporter of the Progressive Party, important in the 1912 Presidential election.

comment.author: 65901644@N00
comment._content: And the 2-8-8-0 locomotive arrangement was known as the "Bull Moose".  I'd never heard of the political connection, but the name probably came from it (it was the most powerful type of locomotive at the time).

comment.author: 31770554@N05
comment._content: 4th man from the left is Louis Hill, son of James J. Hill most likely taken same time and place as LC-B2- 2527-14 Saint Paul Minnesota Union Depot
